availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph S. Asbury (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant.)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Asbury. Father of H. Asbury, Charles Asbury, Joseph Asbury, and George Asbury. Farmer in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1850. Merchant in Ballard County in 1860. Employed Pascall H. Jackson as a clerk in Ballard County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 254B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 116.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 598-9.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 43A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District No. 5, p. 19.
